brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to compare the two surgical approaches namely laparoscopic
      pancreatoduodenectomy and open pancreatoduodenectomy for management of periampullary and
      pancreatic head cancers in terms of parameters like pathological radicality, complication
      rate, peri-operative and  post operative outcomes.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pancreatic Head and Peri-ampullary Cancer Laparoscopic vs Open Surgical Treatment Trial (PLOT)

detailed_description.textblock:
Laparoscopic Pancreatoduodenectomy (LPD) although technically difficult, requiring high
      degree of expertise, has shown equal efficacy in terms of complications, oncological safety
      & overall outcome to that of Open Pancreatoduodenectomy (OPD) with advantages of minimally
      invasive surgery like decreased blood loss, reduced pain, shorter hospital stay & early
      return to work.

      Although current literature from various centers supports its use, the studies done so far
      are, case comparisons of either small sample of population or non-randomized trials.
      According to our knowledge, a randomized trial analyzing open versus laparoscopic
      pancreatoduodenectomy (PD) in terms of complications and outcome, has not been reported.
      With this current study we will try to address this issue.

      This study is a prospective, randomized, parallel group, clinical trail comparing
      Laparoscopic versus open Pancreatoduodenectomy in relation to the pathological radicality &
      the severity of complications according to the expanded Accordion Severity Grading System.

      This is a single institute based trial, being conducted at GEM hospital and research center.
      The trial has been approved by the GEM Hospital ethical committee.

      Through this trial we are planning to enroll patients having resectable periampullary and
      pancreatic head malignant lesion at diagnosis. After full assessment, optimization, approval
      of hospital tumor board with informed consent, those patients selected for surgical therapy
      with curative intention, will be randomized using computer generated random numbers either
      into Laparoscopic Pancreatoduodenectomy (LPD) group or Open Pancreatoduodenectomy (OPD)
      group.

      The details of surgery, blood loss, operating time, conversion if any as well as details of
      postoperative events & complications if any will be recorded in proforma. Protocols for
      adjuvant therapy according to pathological stages will be followed. These patients will be
      reviewed at 1, 3 and 6 months post-surgery.

      The primary outcome will be Complications according to the expanded Accordion Severity
      Grading System And pathological radicality at time of discharge or death. The secondary
      outcomes will be Blood Loss, Operating Time, no of lymph nodes retrieved, Hospital Stay at
      discharge or death. The trial is expected to last for a duration of 2 year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult males or females with a diagnosis of either of resectable Periampullary and
             pancreatic head cancers without

               1. No evidence of metastasis

               2. Radiological non-involvement of Superior Mesenteric Vein  & Portal Vein

               3. Preserved fat planes between celiac axis, Hepatic Artery & Superior Mesenteric
                  Artery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Unresectable Tumor at surgery

          2. Pancreatoduodenectomy with portal vein resection

          3. Pancreatoduodenectomy for other diagnosis like cystic tumors or chronic calcific
             pancreatitis with head mass

          4. With prior Neoadjuvant treatment
